creator: Campbell, Alexander (Sir), 1822-1892. (author)
description: Campbell, Alexander (Sir): 1822-1892. Born in Yorkshire, England; to Canada with family, 1823; called to bar of Upper Canada, 1843; partner in law practice and politics with Sir John A. Macdonald; created K.C.M.G., 1879 (Wallace, Dictionary of Canadian biography). // "Memorandum respecting the case of the Queen v. Riel, prepared at the request of the committee of the Privy Council." Campbell was Minister of Justice during the Riel trial. For French version see Peel 1362.
subject: Rebellions and Regimental Histories--Saskatchewan Rebellion

title: In the case of Louis Riel, convicted of treason and executed therefor: Memorandum of Sir Alexander Campbell
